newsitem.title: MOZAMBIQUE: GENCOR APPROVES GIANT MOZAMBIQUE ALUMINIUM SMELTER.
newsitem.headline: GENCOR APPROVES GIANT MOZAMBIQUE ALUMINIUM SMELTER.

text.p: South Africa's Gencor Ltd said on Tuesday it had decided to invest in a 245,000-tonne-a-year primary aluminium smelter in southern Mozambique.
"Gencor will invest $125 million in the project subject to the securing of international equity investment from suitable partners by the end of 1997," Gencor said in a statement.
"The Gencor decision follows on the approval in-principle decision taken by South Africa's Industrial Development Corporation board to invest a like amount of $125 million."
The project marks by far the largest private sector investment in Mozambqiue to date.

Gencor and the IDC will take up 50 percent of the equity in the Mozal venture. The remaining $250 million of equity capital will be sourced from international partners with the Mozambican government providing "its full support". A similar amount as that raised in equity will be raised in debt.

"We are delighted to be able to give the green light for the Mozal smelter. It means that an investment of more than five billion rands ($1.1 billion) will flow into the Mozambican and South African economies with the potential to establish a very solid base of ongoing hard currency earnings in southern Africa."

The South African mining house added that the project was viable because of a long-term competitive power price offered by South Afican utility Eskom with EDM, the Mozambique Electricity Supply Authority, and the granting of free zone status to to the project by the Mozambican government.
